p: Early reports in Brazil showed antibodies against YFV in specimens of Cebus, Callithrix, and Leontopithecus, in Mato Grosso, Bahia, and Minas Gerais states [ 117â€“ 119]. An extensive immunological survey detected humoral immunity against YFV in Alouatta, Ateles, Aotus, Callicebus, Callithrix, Cebus, Brachyteles, Leontopithecus, Pithecia, and Saimiri in Brazil [ 120]. A recent study [ 121], reported the decline (10 to 26%) of two muriqui populations ( Brachyteles hypoxanthus), from October 2016 to April 2017, in areas with YF outbreaks [ 55], and likely YF was the cause of deaths [ 121].
